segment.source: Getting Started and FAQ
segment.target: Getting Started and FAQ

segment.source: Getting Started and FAQ
segment.target: Getting Started and FAQ

segment.source: This Getting Started guide will help you quickly enable your mobile app for Mobile Application Management with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: This Getting Started guide will help you quickly enable your mobile app for Mobile Application Management with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: You may find it useful to first understand the benefits of the Intune App SDK by reading the “Benefits of the Intune App SDK” document.
segment.target: You may find it useful to first understand the benefits of the Intune App SDK by reading the “Benefits of the Intune App SDK” document.

segment.source: This guide walks through the major steps needed to enable mobile app management in your app with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: This guide walks through the major steps needed to enable mobile app management in your app with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: The Intune App SDK supports similar scenarios across platforms, and is intended to create a consistent experience across the platforms for IT administrators.
segment.target: The Intune App SDK supports similar scenarios across platforms, and is intended to create a consistent experience across the platforms for IT administrators.

segment.source: However, there are small differences in the support of certain features due to platform limitations.
segment.target: However, there are small differences in the support of certain features due to platform limitations.

segment.source: Register your store app with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Register your store app with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: If your enabled app is internal to your company and will not be made available in the Apple or Google app store, you do not need to register your app.
segment.target: If your enabled app is internal to your company and will not be made available in the Apple or Google app store, you do not need to register your app.

segment.source: For such internal apps, the IT administrator will load them directly into the Microsoft Intune console for deployment, Intune will detect that the app has been built with the SDK, and will present the IT administrator with the option of applying MAM policy to it.
segment.target: For such internal apps, the IT administrator will load them directly into the Microsoft Intune console for deployment, Intune will detect that the app has been built with the SDK, and will present the IT administrator with the option of applying MAM policy to it.

segment.source: You can skip to the section titled “Enable your iOS or Android mobile app for MAM with the SDK” located here.
segment.target: You can skip to the section titled “Enable your iOS or Android mobile app for MAM with the SDK” located here.

segment.source: If you are an ISV developing an app that will be made available to customers through either Apple or Google app stores, you must first register your app with Microsoft Intune and agree to the registration terms.
segment.target: If you are an ISV developing an app that will be made available to customers through either Apple or Google app stores, you must first register your app with Microsoft Intune and agree to the registration terms.

segment.source: You can supply the app’s deep link at this time.
segment.target: You can supply the app’s deep link at this time.

segment.source: Afterward an IT administrator can apply Intune MAM policy to the app.
segment.target: Afterward an IT administrator can apply Intune MAM policy to the app.

segment.source: Until registration has been complete and confirmed by the Microsoft Intune team, your app deep link will not be given the option to apply MAM policy in the admin console.
segment.target: Until registration has been complete and confirmed by the Microsoft Intune team, your app deep link will not be given the option to apply MAM policy in the admin console.

segment.source: Microsoft also maintains a Microsoft Intune Partners web site where the app will be registered so that customers will know that it supports Microsoft Intune MAM policy.
segment.target: Microsoft also maintains a Microsoft Intune Partners web site where the app will be registered so that customers will know that it supports Microsoft Intune MAM policy.

segment.source: To begin the registration process, review and sign the Microsoft Intune Partner Agreement.
segment.target: To begin the registration process, review and sign the Microsoft Intune Partner Agreement.

segment.source: This agreement describes the terms your company must accept before becoming a Microsoft Intune app partner.
segment.target: This agreement describes the terms your company must accept before becoming a Microsoft Intune app partner.

segment.source: You will need to sign in before you can view this document.
segment.target: You will need to sign in before you can view this document.

segment.source: You can find the agreement in the Intune App SDK Microsoft Connect site under the Surveys tab or located here.
segment.target: You can find the agreement in the Intune App SDK Microsoft Connect site under the Surveys tab or located here.

segment.source: We will also ask you to provide the name of the app, your company’s name, as well as the Google or iTunes store deep link to your app.
segment.target: We will also ask you to provide the name of the app, your company’s name, as well as the Google or iTunes store deep link to your app.

segment.source: We will use your registration email address to confirm and complete receipt of the registration process.
segment.target: We will use your registration email address to confirm and complete receipt of the registration process.

segment.source: Additionally, we use your registration email address to contact you should we have any concerns.
segment.target: Additionally, we use your registration email address to contact you should we have any concerns.

segment.source: What to expect in the registration process: After you have submitted the form you will be contacted by
segment.target: What to expect in the registration process: After you have submitted the form you will be contacted by

segment.source: Microsoft via your registration email address, to either confirm successful receipt or request additional
segment.target: Microsoft via your registration email address, to either confirm successful receipt or request additional

segment.source: information to complete the registration.
segment.target: information to complete the registration.

segment.source: You will also be contacted when your app is successfully
segment.target: You will also be contacted when your app is successfully

segment.source: registered with the Microsoft Intune and when your app is featured on the Microsoft Intune partners’
segment.target: registered with the Microsoft Intune and when your app is featured on the Microsoft Intune partners’

segment.source: site.
segment.target: site.

segment.source: After receipt of the information has been confirmed, your app deep link will be included in the next
segment.target: After receipt of the information has been confirmed, your app deep link will be included in the next

segment.source: monthly Intune Service update.
segment.target: monthly Intune Service update.

segment.source: For example, if the registration information is completed in July, the app
segment.target: For example, if the registration information is completed in July, the app

segment.source: deep link will be supported in mid-August.
segment.target: deep link will be supported in mid-August.

segment.source: If your store app deep link changes in the future, you will need to re-register you app.
segment.target: If your store app deep link changes in the future, you will need to re-register you app.

segment.source: Also, inform us if
segment.target: Also, inform us if

segment.source: you update your app with a new version of the Intune App SDK.
segment.target: you update your app with a new version of the Intune App SDK.

segment.source: All information collected in the form above and through e-mail correspondence with the Intune
segment.target: All information collected in the form above and through e-mail correspondence with the Intune

segment.source: team will honor the Microsoft Privacy Statement.
segment.target: team will honor the Microsoft Privacy Statement.

segment.source: Enable your iOS or Android mobile app for MAM with the SDK
segment.target: Enable your iOS or Android mobile app for MAM with the SDK

segment.source: To enable your iOS mobile app, you will need the following:
segment.target: To enable your iOS mobile app, you will need the following:

segment.source: Intune App SDK for iOS Developer Guide: this document will walk you step-by-step through
segment.target: Intune App SDK for iOS Developer Guide: this document will walk you step-by-step through

segment.source: enabling your mobile iOS app with the Intune App SDK.
segment.target: enabling your mobile iOS app with the Intune App SDK.

segment.source: You can find this document in the
segment.target: You can find this document in the

segment.source: documentation folder that you have downloaded as part of the Intune App SDK package.
segment.target: documentation folder that you have downloaded as part of the Intune App SDK package.

segment.source: Intune App SDK for iOS: as part of the Intune App SDK package downloaded from Microsoft
segment.target: Intune App SDK for iOS: as part of the Intune App SDK package downloaded from Microsoft

segment.source: Intune, you will find a signed folder “Intune App SDK for iOS.”
segment.target: Intune, you will find a signed folder “Intune App SDK for iOS.”

segment.source: This folder has all the Intune App
segment.target: This folder has all the Intune App

segment.source: SDK for iOS content.
segment.target: SDK for iOS content.

segment.source: To enable your android mobile app with Intune App SDK, you will need the following:
segment.target: To enable your android mobile app with Intune App SDK, you will need the following:

segment.source: Intune App SDK for Android Developer Guide: This document will walk you step-by-step
segment.target: Intune App SDK for Android Developer Guide: This document will walk you step-by-step

segment.source: through enabling your mobile android app with Intune App SDK.
segment.target: through enabling your mobile android app with Intune App SDK.

segment.source: You can find this document in
segment.target: You can find this document in

segment.source: the documentation folder that you have downloaded as part of the Intune App SDK package.
segment.target: the documentation folder that you have downloaded as part of the Intune App SDK package.

segment.source: Intune App SDK for Android: As part of the Intune App SDK package downloaded from
segment.target: Intune App SDK for Android: As part of the Intune App SDK package downloaded from

segment.source: Microsoft Intune, you will find a signed folder “Intune App SDK for Android.”
segment.target: Microsoft Intune, you will find a signed folder “Intune App SDK for Android.”

segment.source: This folder has all
segment.target: This folder has all

segment.source: the Intune App SDK for android content.
segment.target: the Intune App SDK for android content.

segment.source: Turning off Telemetry for your app
segment.target: Turning off Telemetry for your app

segment.source: For IOS MAM SDK Developers, the SDK logs SDK telemetry data on usage events by default.
segment.target: For IOS MAM SDK Developers, the SDK logs SDK telemetry data on usage events by default.

segment.source: This data is
segment.target: This data is

segment.source: sent to Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: sent to Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: If you choose not to send SDK telemetry data to Microsoft Intune from your application, you must
segment.target: If you choose not to send SDK telemetry data to Microsoft Intune from your application, you must

segment.source: disable SDK telemetry transmission by setting the property to ‘YES’ in
segment.target: disable SDK telemetry transmission by setting the property to ‘YES’ in

segment.source: the IntuneMAMSettings.
segment.target: the IntuneMAMSettings.

segment.source: For Android MAM SDK Developers, SDK telemetry data is not logged through the SDK.
segment.target: For Android MAM SDK Developers, SDK telemetry data is not logged through the SDK.

segment.source: Test your MAM enabled app with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Test your MAM enabled app with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Once you’ve completed the necessary steps to enlighten (integrate the Intune App SDK) your iOS or Android Intune App SDK, you will need to ensure that all the app management policies are enabled and functioning for the end user and the IT administrator.
segment.target: Once you’ve completed the necessary steps to enlighten (integrate the Intune App SDK) your iOS or Android Intune App SDK, you will need to ensure that all the app management policies are enabled and functioning for the end user and the IT administrator.

segment.source: To test your enlightened app, you will need the following:
segment.target: To test your enlightened app, you will need the following:

segment.source: Testing your MAM enabled app with Microsoft Intune: This document will walk you through step-by-step how to test your enlightened iOS or android apps with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Testing your MAM enabled app with Microsoft Intune: This document will walk you through step-by-step how to test your enlightened iOS or android apps with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: You can find this document in the documentation folder that you have downloaded as part of the Intune App SDK package.
segment.target: You can find this document in the documentation folder that you have downloaded as part of the Intune App SDK package.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune Account: To test your MAM enabled apps with Microsoft Intune, you will need a Microsoft Intune account.
segment.target: Microsoft Intune Account: To test your MAM enabled apps with Microsoft Intune, you will need a Microsoft Intune account.

segment.source: If you are an ISV enabling your iOS or android store apps for MAM, you will receive a promo code once you complete the registration with Microsoft Intune as outlined in the registration step.
segment.target: If you are an ISV enabling your iOS or android store apps for MAM, you will receive a promo code once you complete the registration with Microsoft Intune as outlined in the registration step.

segment.source: The promo code will allow you to sign up for a Microsoft Intune trial for 1 year of extended use.
segment.target: The promo code will allow you to sign up for a Microsoft Intune trial for 1 year of extended use.

segment.source: If you are developing a line of business app that will not be shipped to the store, you are expected to have access for Microsoft Intune through your organization.
segment.target: If you are developing a line of business app that will not be shipped to the store, you are expected to have access for Microsoft Intune through your organization.

segment.source: You can also sign up for 1-month free trial in with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: You can also sign up for 1-month free trial in with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Frequently Asked Questions about the Intune App SDK
segment.target: Frequently Asked Questions about the Intune App SDK

segment.source: I found an issue with the Intune App SDK or documentation.
segment.target: I found an issue with the Intune App SDK or documentation.

segment.source: How do I submit feedback or report issues?
segment.target: How do I submit feedback or report issues?

segment.source: Feedback on the Intune App SDK can be submitted through the Microsoft Connect site here.
segment.target: Feedback on the Intune App SDK can be submitted through the Microsoft Connect site here.

segment.source: You will see an option to submit the feedback or issue there.
segment.target: You will see an option to submit the feedback or issue there.

segment.source: Please provide a priority for submitted issues, and the Microsoft Intune team will address them as soon as possible.
segment.target: Please provide a priority for submitted issues, and the Microsoft Intune team will address them as soon as possible.

segment.source: How does the Intune App SDK treat OS updates and compatibility?
segment.target: How does the Intune App SDK treat OS updates and compatibility?

segment.source: We will strive to ensure that existing SDK features will work on new OS version as soon as possible, and that the SDK will not cause application crashes or other serious end user impact due to new OS features accessible to end users from within existing applications.
segment.target: We will strive to ensure that existing SDK features will work on new OS version as soon as possible, and that the SDK will not cause application crashes or other serious end user impact due to new OS features accessible to end users from within existing applications.

segment.source: When sufficient lead time is provided by OS vendors, Intune will provide support for OS Beta versions to enable application pre-release testing.
segment.target: When sufficient lead time is provided by OS vendors, Intune will provide support for OS Beta versions to enable application pre-release testing.

segment.source: ISVs should report in advance any discovered compatibility issues or plans to release application versions targeting OS preview versions.
segment.target: ISVs should report in advance any discovered compatibility issues or plans to release application versions targeting OS preview versions.

segment.source: New features added to the SDK will not break existing OS compatibility without advanced notice and agreement from Microsoft; unintentional compatibility issues will be handled as bugs.
segment.target: New features added to the SDK will not break existing OS compatibility without advanced notice and agreement from Microsoft; unintentional compatibility issues will be handled as bugs.

segment.source: How does the Intune App SDK affect my mobile app?
segment.target: How does the Intune App SDK affect my mobile app?

segment.source: The SDK can affect application in three main ways.
segment.target: The SDK can affect application in three main ways.

segment.source: Performance: The methods used to enforce policy may impact application performance.
segment.target: Performance: The methods used to enforce policy may impact application performance.

segment.source: Please test the performance and report any issues as bugs and include performance results with and without policy for the scenario.
segment.target: Please test the performance and report any issues as bugs and include performance results with and without policy for the scenario.

segment.source: Optional Features: The SDK supports optional features through the API surface (e.g. save-as).
segment.target: Optional Features: The SDK supports optional features through the API surface (e.g. save-as).

segment.source: These features require application changes to support.
segment.target: These features require application changes to support.

segment.source: Telemetry is an “opt-in” feature.
segment.target: Telemetry is an “opt-in” feature.

segment.source: The iOS MAM SDK logs SDK telemetry data on usage events by default.
segment.target: The iOS MAM SDK logs SDK telemetry data on usage events by default.

segment.source: This data gets sent to Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: This data gets sent to Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: If you choose not to send SDK telemetry data to Microsoft Intune from your application, you must disable SDK telemetry capture by setting the property to ‘YES’ in the IntuneMAMSettings.
segment.target: If you choose not to send SDK telemetry data to Microsoft Intune from your application, you must disable SDK telemetry capture by setting the property to ‘YES’ in the IntuneMAMSettings.

segment.source: Policy Enforcement: When MAM Policy is applied to SDK applications, application features and user experience may be altered.
segment.target: Policy Enforcement: When MAM Policy is applied to SDK applications, application features and user experience may be altered.

segment.source: Application teams should work with the Intune team to test their applications to understand this impact.
segment.target: Application teams should work with the Intune team to test their applications to understand this impact.
